VBQModelTitle: Our MileagePlus Premier program is evolving.
VBQModelDescription: Beginning on January 1, 2020, our program is changing: youll earn credit based on the value of the tickets youve purchased (PQP) and the number of flights youve taken (PQF). Youll also be able to earn PQP on select flights ticketed and operated by Star Alliance partners, paid upgrades on United, MileagePlus Upgrade Award co-pays, and from spend on your co-branded Chase card.

EarnedMilesText:
Award miles shown are the miles that can be earned for this flight. Mileage accrued will vary depending on the terms and conditions of your frequent flyer program. United MileagePlus mileage accrual and other benefits of MileagePlus associated with air travel are subject to the rules of the MileagePlus program.

You can earn up to 75,000 award miles per ticket. The 75,000 award miles cap may be applied to your posted flight activity in an order different than shown.
OneClickEnrollmentTimeOutError: You're on your way to collecting rewards for your travel adventures. Keep an eye out for your enrollment confirmation email with your new MileagePlus number.
CorporateBookingNotEligibleMessage: This booking account is no longer active. For more information, please contact your corporate booking manager.
eResNRPSAdvisoryMessage:
London or Tokyo, New York or San Francisco ‐ wherever you're traveling for work, we want you to book company business travel responsibly. Here are a few tips to help you ensure that you're doing it right:

  • If your schedule permits and you are not declaring “must ride” status, choose a flight that is not at or over capacity.

  • If your plans have changed and you no longer need to travel, make sure to cancel in advance the bookings you don't need, so United has the opportunity to sell that seat. Cancellations made within one hour of scheduled departure are reported to your leadership team.

  • As with other travel, please avoid creating duplicate bookings. Examples of duplicate bookings could be booking EWR SMF and EWR DEN SMF or IAH SFO and IAH LAX, or booking the same city pair at two different times of the day. Since you will only be able to fly on one itinerary, duplicate bookings prevent United from selling seats that would otherwise be available. Double bookings are subject to automatic cancellation and are reported to your leadership team.

  • Need to review your current positive space bookings? Simply select the “Travel plans” tab - we've listed all your bookings in date order.

For more information, check out the Company Business Travel Policy on Flying Together. Have a question? Try Help Hub to search for answers to commonly asked questions about this policy, submit requests to the Employee Travel Center and get real-time updates on your requests.
eResNRPSAdvisoryMessageTraining:
You are creating a positive-space booking which will take a revenue seat out of inventory that could otherwise have been sold. Please book positive-space travel responsibly.

Pilots
The boarding priority of Training Travel (PS0T) may only be selected for travel directly related to simulator recurrent training assignments (CQ) and only for travel between your primary residence or your Base and the CQ event.  For all other travel related to training that is not CQ, such as training for new equipment, please select normal Business Travel (PS5B).

Flight attendants
The boarding priority of Training Travel (PSOU) may only be selected for travel directly related to recurrent training assignments (CQ), equipment training or purser training for pmUA flight attendants and only for travel between your primary residence or your Base and the training event.For pmCO flight attendants travelling to training, you do not need to list for travel because the deadhead travel is built into the training pairing from the base to the training location. For pmCO only, if you wish to travel from your home to training, contact crew scheduling to have FAKE placed in your deadhead then list for training travel through employeeRES.

 • Booking multiple positive-space bookings to the same or similar destination for the same business trip is not permitted.

Examples: Holding positive space for ORD PEK and IAD PEK or IAH LHR and IAH CDG for the same trip are considered duplicate bookings, as it is only possible to fly one.  Holding two positive-space bookings for IAH ORD at different times for the same trip is considered a duplicate booking.  Duplicate bookings are subject to automatic cancellation.

 • Cancel your positive space booking promptly if you determine the flights are no longer needed.

 • No-Shows and last minute cancellations should be carefully avoided.

 • Duplicate and no-show bookings are reported to VP of each division.

 • To review your current positive space bookings select the “My Travel Plans” tab.

The Company Business Policy can be found on Flying Together > Travel > Company Business.  Questions regarding this policy can be directed to etc@united.com.
eResNRPSAdvisoryMessageDeviation:
You are creating a positive-space booking which will take a revenue seat out of inventory that could otherwise have been sold. Please book positive-space travel responsibly.

 • Booking multiple positive-space bookings to the same or similar destination for the same business trip is not permitted.

Examples: Holding positive space for ORD PEK and IAD PEK or IAH LHR and IAH CDG for the same trip are considered duplicate bookings, as it is only possible to fly one. Holding two positive-space bookings for IAH ORD at different times for the same trip is considered a duplicate booking. Duplicate bookings are subject to automatic cancellation.

 • Consider other flight options for segments at or over capacity if your schedule permits and you are not considered must ride.

 • Cancel your positive space booking promptly if you determine the flights are no longer needed.

 • No-Shows and last minute cancellations should be carefully avoided.

 • Duplicate and no-show bookings are reported to VP of each division.

 • To review your current positive space bookings select the “My Travel Plans” tab.

The Company Business Policy can be found on Flying Together > Travel > Company Business Travel.  Questions regarding this policy can be directed to etc@united.com or try United ServiceAnywhere where you can search for answers to commonly asked questions, submit your requests and monitor services/solutions online.

The Emergency Pass Travel policy can be found on Flying Together > Travel  > Travel homepage > IN THIS SECTION > Types of travel> Emergency travel. Have a question? Try  Help Hub to search for answers to commonly asked questions about this policy, submit requests to the Employee Travel Center and get real-time updates on your requests.
TnC:
All co-workers, early-out participants and retirees are responsible for all pass travel transactions (and all confidential information on United�s intranet) and are encouraged to safeguard their passwords, even from pass riders who wish to book pass travel. All co-workers, retirees and early-out participants are responsible for understanding the pass travel tax calculations and for providing pass travel information and practices to all persons using their flight privileges. Co-workers, retirees and early-out participants also are responsible for ensuring that their pass riders understand and comply with all pass travel policies, including these guidelines. 

All travel passes and reduced-rate tickets are for leisure travel only and are not to be sold, bartered or used for personal gain or business purposes. Leisure travel is subject to audit. Those who travel frequently are advised to retain documentation that verifies travel is for leisure only. All will be held accountable for any misuse of travel privileges and for violation of the travel policy by themselves, pass riders and buddies. 

Examples of misuse or abuse of flight privileges include, but are not limited to, providing enrolled friend status or buddy ePasses to individuals who are not your known family members or personal friends; providing pass travel privileges to individuals whom you don�t know, including for use by a third person; providing pass travel privileges to current co-workers who are under disciplinary investigation; former co-workers who were under disciplinary investigation at the time of their termination of employment or who were involuntarily terminated from employment are not eligible for any form of pass travel; providing travel passes to individuals whose travel will result in personal gain or business purposes. Any misuse, abuse or other unauthorized use of flight privileges will result in disciplinary action up to and including full-fare reimbursement and termination of employment. 

Holding either a confirmed reservation or a positive-space booking takes a revenue seat out of inventory that could otherwise have been sold. Pass riders may not hold a confirmed reservation and a positive-space or space-available booking over the same routing for the same trip (example: myUA discount ticket and a space-available or positive space booking). Pass riders may not hold more than one positive-space booking to the same or similar destination for the same business trip. Employees and their pass riders are prohibited from booking revenue reservations for friends and family unless their job functions specifically require them to do so. Those who are allowed to book revenue reservations must follow all fare and booking rules. 

In the event of a flight delay or cancellation, pass riders are not eligible for accommodation on another airline or hotel and meal expenses that may be offered to revenue customers. 

United�s pass travel policy is a privilege and is not a right of employment. The terms of the policy are subject to modification or termination, in whole or in part, by the company at any time and for any reason. 

Clicking Accept confirms your acceptance and understanding of the Pass Travel Guidelines  , acknowledges your responsibility to be fully familiar with all of the Pass Travel Policies and Travel Tax Calculations. Co-workers, retirees and early-out participants will be prompted to accept these Guidelines every 90 days and may view them at any time by selecting the Pass Travel Guidelines link on the Travel tab of Flying Together.
